data.title: Obituary for Vasilios "Bill" Karagounis
data.meta_description: Adportal - Self Service Advertising Made Easy, powered by iPublish Media Solutions.
data.text:
Vasilios "Bill" Karagounis

Apr 3, 1953 -

Sep 4, 2021

On Saturday, Sept. 4, 2021, Vasilios "Bill" Karagounis passed away, at the age of 68.

He was born on April 3, 1953, in Nerotrivia, Greece!

His parents were George and Anastasia; his brother, Demitri; sister, Elaine; and younger brother, Tony.

Bill came to the state of Alaska in 1976; he moved to the area where his cousins have a restaurant and he worked with them for a few years.

Bill eventually made is way to Palmer, Alaska, where him and his brother Tony opened up their own restaurant Pizza Ria Delphi; for 38 years he was well-known for his pizza.

On May 24, 1986, Bill met his wonderful wife Kiki in Greece, and they just celebrated their 35th anniversary. Bill and Kiki enjoyed a wonderful life together.

Bill was known for his amazing cooking and he loved to cook for others, he also loved to fish, be in his garden and play his Greek instrument the bouzouki for his friends.

But the thing he was known for by others was his love for the Bible and teaching people about the wonderful future and what Jehovah promises for all mankind.

One of his favorite scriptures was Revelation 21:4 says: God will wipe out every tear from their eyes and death will be no more, neither will mourning nor outcry nor pain be anymore.

Bill's smile and laughter will be missed so much by friends and family, and we can't wait till that day when we can see him again perfect in a paradise earth.
